main_definition: To have descended from a higher to a lower position, typically as a result of movement or loss of stability.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having failed or declined in status, condition, or value.
meanings_and_examples.example: After the economic downturn, many businesses have fallen on hard times.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To become separated from a group or to lose connection with others.
meanings_and_examples.example: The hiker fell behind and could no longer keep up with his friends.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Achieving victory in a competition by defeating an opponent, especially in sports or games.
meanings_and_examples.example: The home team managed to fall to their rivals, winning the championship title.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To become less effective or efficient over time.
meanings_and_examples.example: Technology has fallen behind as it fails to keep up with rapid advancements.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of collapsing, especially due to being struck by an object while in flight.
meanings_and_examples.example: A tree limb fell during the storm and damaged part of the roof.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To experience a loss or decrease in value or amount.
meanings_and_examples.example: The company's profits have fallen due to decreased sales.
